metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13094 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in fs/xfs/libxfs/xfs_attr_leaf.c in the Linuxkernel through 4.17.3. An OOPS may occur for a corrupted xfs image afterxfs_da_shrink_inode() is called with a NULL bp.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-33.36
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-33.36
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1021-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1021.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1020.20
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-azure - 4.15.0-1022.23
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-gcp - 4.15.0-1018.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1020.20
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1017-oem - 4.15.0-1017.20
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-33.36').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1020.20').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.23').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1018.19').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1020.20').
linux-oem package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1017.20').
